qas.question: What date was the Charleston earthquake of 1886?
How many buildings were damaged by the 1886 earthquake in Charleston?
What was the cost of the damage of the 1886 earthquake to the city of Charleston?
What was the total value of all of Charleston's city buildings before the earthquake?
What date was the Charleston earthquake of 1868?
How many buildings were damaged by the 1868 earthquake in Charleston?
What was the cost of the damage of the 1868 earthquake to the city of Charleston?
What was the total value of some of Charleston's city buildings before the earthquake?

context: On <a1_0><b6_0>August 31, 1886<b6_0/><a1_0/>, Charleston was nearly destroyed by <a0_0><b5_0>an earthquake<b5_0/><a0_0/>. The shock was estimated to have a moment magnitude of 7.0 and a maximum Mercalli intensity of X (Extreme). It was felt as far away as Boston to the north, Chicago and Milwaukee to the northwest, as far west as New Orleans, as far south as Cuba, and as far east as Bermuda. It damaged <a2_0><b7_0>2,000 buildings<b7_0/><a2_0/> in Charleston and caused <a3_0><b8_0>$6 million<b8_0/><a3_0/> worth of damage ($133 million in 2006 dollars), at a time when all the city's buildings were valued around <a4_0><b9_0>$24 million<b9_0/><a4_0/> ($531 million in 2006 dollars).
